country.name: Austria
country.description: Austria, officially the Republic of Austria, is a federal republic and a landlocked country of over 8.8 million people in Central Europe.

popular_destinations.name: Vienna
popular_destinations.description: Vienna is the federal capital and largest city of Austria and one of the nine states of Austria.

popular_destinations.name: Innsbruck
popular_destinations.description: Innsbruck is the capital city of Tyrol in western Austria and the fifth-largest city in Austria.

popular_destinations.name: Graz
popular_destinations.description: Graz is the capital of Styria and the second-largest city in Austria after Vienna. On 1 January 2018, it had a population of 325,021.

popular_destinations.name: Linz
popular_destinations.description: Linz is the third-largest city of Austria and capital of the state of Upper Austria.

popular_destinations.name: Klagenfurt
popular_destinations.description: Klagenfurt am Wörthersee is the capital of the federal state of Carinthia in Austria.

points_of_interest.name: Saint Stephen's Cathedral
points_of_interest.description: Commonly referred to by its local name, Stephansdom, this spectacular 12th-century cathedral is one of the most important churches in the…

points_of_interest.name: Hofburg Palace
points_of_interest.description: Do not miss out on visiting this palace if you want to see what used to be the beating heart of the Habsburg monarchy.

points_of_interest.name: Vienna State Opera
points_of_interest.description: Prestigious and high-class, this opera house is to the world's opera what Oxford is to the world's universities.

points_of_interest.name: Vienna City Hall
points_of_interest.description: The neo-gothic building (built in 1883) located on the Rathausplatz, is the heart of Viennese political life.

points_of_interest.name: Schonbrunn Palace
points_of_interest.description: Nowhere in Vienna is its imperial history more palpable than in the Schönbrunn Palace.

points_of_interest.name: Graben Street
points_of_interest.description: The famous Viennese shopping area dates back to the times of the Roman Empire when there was a long moat protecting the city.

points_of_interest.name: Naschmarkt
points_of_interest.description: This large market is a gourmet's heaven. Specialized in all things edible, you can find anything your heart and taste buds desire here among…

points_of_interest.name: Upper Belvedere
points_of_interest.description: Part of the Belvedere palace complex, this splendid Baroque palace is well worth a visit for its architectural and aesthetic value alone.

points_of_interest.name: Mariahilfer Street
points_of_interest.description: The longest shopping street in Austria. Not only that, it is also the street with the largest number of shops in Austria.

points_of_interest.name: Hundertwasser House
points_of_interest.description: One of the most popular buildings in Vienna as well as one of the most extraordinary ones, this house is a must-see for any fan of…

popular_tours.name: Munich 2.5-Hour Segway Tour
popular_tours.description: Experience an unforgettable 2.5-hour tour of Munich's most beautiful places and attractions by Segway. On this unique tour your professional tour guide will tell you facts about the most interesting sights in Munich and answer your questions.

popular_tours.name: Salzburg Card: Free Admission and Free Rides
popular_tours.description: Get free access to all of the top sights and attractions in and around Salzburg with the Salzburg Card. Take advantage of free and unlimited use of public transportation, and enjoy lots of additional discounts and perks at locations across the city.

popular_tours.name: Glide Through History: Munich 3.5-Hour Segway Tour
popular_tours.description: Glide through history on a 3.5-hour Segway tour of Munich and learn about the city’s development from a small medieval town to one of the world’s most advanced cities. See the Deutsches Museum, Englischer Garten, Prinzregentenstraße, and much more.

popular_tours.name: Munich 1.5-Hour Introductory Segway Tour
popular_tours.description: Discover Munich on this exciting 1.5-hour Segway tour. Glide around the city on the electronic scooter and see the picturesque English Garden, the Isar riverbank with its villas and the Chinese Tower.

popular_tours.name: Dachau Memorial Site: Full-Day Tour
popular_tours.description: Take a tour of the Dachau Memorial Site on a day trip from Munich and explore the camp with a highly experienced Memorial-qualified guide. Dachau was the first permanent concentration camp built by Nazi Germany and the model for the others that followed.

popular_tours.name: Tyrolean Evenings Family Gundolf in Innsbruck
popular_tours.description: Experience traditional Austrian folk music culture as the Gundolf Family entertains you with a 1.5-hour program. Listen to authentic folk music, see Tyrolean dance and "shoe-slapping," and hear traditional yodeling while enjoying a drink or 3-course meal.

popular_tours.name: Neuschwanstein Tour from Munich: Groups of 4 or More
popular_tours.description: In groups of four or more, travel through the Bavarian Alps to the fairy tale castle of Neuschwanstein. Enjoy a guided tour of the castle, see the 17th-century church of Wieskirch, and try out the cheese and sausages at a Bavarian cheese farm.

popular_tours.name: Munich Guided Walking Tour - Birthplace of the Third Reich
popular_tours.description: Explore Munich through the history of the Third Reich and visit WWII locations associated with the rise to power of Hitler and the Nazis. Discover beer halls where Hitler gave important speeches, the Nazi HQ, monuments to Nazi opponents, and much more.

popular_tours.name: Munich by Segway: 3.5-Hour Tour through the Old Town
popular_tours.description: Discover Munich from a new perspective on this exciting 3.5-hour Segway tour through the old town. Ride along the Isar river to the most beautiful locations in Munich including the English Garden, the Maximilianeum, and the Angel of Peace.

popular_tours.name: Zugspitze: Full-Day Excursion to Germany's Highest Peak
popular_tours.description: Travel to Garmisch-Partenkirchen from Munich and ascend the Zugspitze, Germany’s highest mountain, by cable car. Have a beer at the highest beer garden in the country and take a round-trip ride through the mountains by a cog-wheel train as well!

popular_tours.name: Munich: Concert in the Court Chapel of the Residenz
popular_tours.description: Enjoy masterpieces of classical music in the Court Chapel, one of the jewels of the Munich Residenz. Listen to Residenz soloists and members of the Munich Philharmonic Orchestra before ending the evening with a delicious 3-course meal.

popular_tours.name: From Salzburg: Private Tour of Hallstatt
popular_tours.description: Venture into Austria's Lake District on a private tour from Salzburg, and visit the UNESCO World Heritage Site of Hallstatt in the Salzkammergut region. Journey along the emerald-green Fuschlsee, see the emperor's summer palace in Bad Ischl and more

popular_tours.name: Premium Tour: Neuschwanstein & Linderhof
popular_tours.description: Exclusive day trip to the castles - convenient and hassle free luxury long distance coach. Experience a truly royal day in a small group and visit the fairytale castles of Neuschwanstein, Linderhof and the village of Oberammergau.

popular_tours.name: Cesky Krumlov: Private 2-Hour City Walking Tour
popular_tours.description: See the best sights available, and hear the striking story of the historic Cesky Krumlov. Learn about history, life under communism, and life in the present day from your experienced, English-speaking guide.

popular_tours.name: Munich: Beer and Food Tour in German
popular_tours.description: Get to know Munich's history of beer brewing and enjoy a private guided tour through the Beer and Oktoberfest Museum. Sample different beers and taste the difference during a beer tasting.

popular_tours.name: Zeichen & Wunder: lucky places in Munich
popular_tours.description: Explore the Bavarian capital and its attractions dedicated to the miracle. Embark on a wonderful, magical tour through the old town of Munich and discover the signs and wonders that surround the Munich daily.

popular_tours.name: Munich: Medieval night watchman torch tour
popular_tours.description: Explore Munich's old town at dusk and follow the night watchman at his evening round. Listen to the exciting stories and legends and admire the impressive sights of the city in the evening.

popular_tours.name: Salzburg: Fortress Concert
popular_tours.description: Experience a Classical evening at the Hohensalzburg Fortress and let the sounds of Wolfgang Amadeus Mozart enchant you. Enjoy an exceptional atmosphere and an incredible view of the city.

popular_tours.name: Munich: Mike's Superior 5-Hour Bike Tour
popular_tours.description: Enjoy a 5-hour bike ride through Munich and see some extra sights not covered on the standard bike tour. Your guide will tell you about landmarks and surroundings you come across during a fun and easy ride. Stop at a beer garden for some food and drink.

popular_tours.name: Königssee Full-Day Tour from Munich
popular_tours.description: Visit the magical Königssee in the Berchtesgaden Alps of Bavaria. Explore Germany’s third deepest lake, a fjord-like body of water, surrounded by towering rock faces. Take a boat ride on the lake, and drive along some of the most scenic Alpine roads.
